newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.Africa JSE share liquidity boosted by JET system.
newsitem.headline: S.Africa JSE share liquidity boosted by JET system.

text.p: The introduction of the electronic Johannesburg Equities Trading system had boosted the frequency with which shares were traded on the Johannesburg Stock Exchange (JSE), the exchange said on Monday.
It said on average there was trade in 57 percent of the 824 securities listed on the exchange on any one day during September compared with 37 percent in September 1995.
Annualised liquidity on the JSE had increased to 9.9 percent for the nine months to September 30 1996, compared to 6.8 percent for the same period last year.
Other factors which had boosted liquidity were overall market conditions, the halving of marketable securities tax to 0.5 percent and the restructuring of the JSE, the exchange said.
